page.title: 13WASTE DISPOSAL AT CHESTERTON
page.content: The Cotswold District Council's waste disposal depot in Chesterton Lane is the 10th largest in England.It serves a population of 69,500 in an area of 114,245 hectares.Of the 100 people who work at the depot 24 men collect the rubbish in 8 special trucks,3 trucks are kept in reserve.Each of the trucks can collect from 400 homes before it is full.Chesterton/Siddington yields 15 tons of rubbish per week.The drivers and bin men work a 39 hour week.The busiest time is the two weeks after Christmas. Once the rubbish is collected it is taken 3.5 km to Fosse Cross where it is buried.Council house repairs,white lining,foul water tank emptying,gritting of roads and grass cutting are also carried out from this depot.The men who work here like their job for,though unpleasant at times,it is always varied and interesting.
